newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia names new diamond, precious metals head.
newsitem.headline: Russia names new diamond, precious metals head.

text.p: Russia's new industry ministry has named a former diamond official to head its department for precious metals and precious stones, Itar-Tass news agency said on Wednesday.

It quoted sources in the recently-formed ministry as saying Vladimir Piskunov, formerly a vice-president of Almazy Rossii-Sakha (ARS), Russia's largest diamond producer and sole authorised exporter, had been appointed department chief.
Piskunov told Reuters that the new industry minister, Yuri Bespalov, had appointed him on Monday.
"I have only worked for two days," he said. "We are working on the structuring of the department, mainly on the division of duties between the finance and industry ministries."
ARS resumed negotiations with De Beers Consolidated Mines Ltd on Tuesday on an agreement to sell Russian output on world markets.

An August 14 presidential decree said the responsibilities of the Committee for Precious Metals and Precious Stones (Komdragmet), which oversees diamond and precious metals output, would be divided between the finance and industry ministries.
Piskunov said the division of duties would likely be formalised this week.
Komdragmet and ARS have each been seeking greater leverage over Russia's diamond industry.
